result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF237, 15CM147, 15CM253, 15CF271 and 15CM219 called together at 2:39pm [mo]

Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing Arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Jackson

Upon direction of the Court, the Clerk contacts the Child Support Agency to inquire of Mr. Jackson's current child support payment status
Atty. Antholine appears in the Courtroom at 3:41pm
With permission of Mr. Jackson, the Court questions Atty. Antholine as to case 14FA113
Atty. Antholine exits the Courtroom at 3:45pm


As to Case 15CM219, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 135 days in the County Jail, WITHOUT Huber, this sentence is to commence FORTHWITH
--pay court costs plus $33 in subpoena fees, to be converted to Civil Judgement


As to Case 15CF271, Count #1  the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 year in Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM219
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge= $618,  to be converted to Civil Judgement

As to Case 15CF271, Counts #9 and #10, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term of 3 years 


As to Case 15CF237, Counts #1, #2, and #3, with Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term on 5 years


As to Case 15CF237, Count #5, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term of 2 years

Probation Conditions as to Counts 9 and 10 in Case 15CF271 and Case 15CF237:
--Certified Batterers' Treatment and Intervention Programming and follow through with treatment recommendations
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--No Contact with: Shantavia Armstrong, unless approved by DOC Agent and JCHS
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--No contact with any of Shatavia Armstrong's children, unless approved by Ms. Armstrong, Human Services, DOC Agent, Case Manager and GAL(if under CHIPS order)
--no possession of any dangerous weapons or ammunition
--As to Case 15CF271, Count #9: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF271, Count #10:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $205
--As to Case 15CF237, Count #1:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF237,Count #2:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF237,Count #3:to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--As to Case 15CF237,Count #5: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge


The Court determines that Mr. Jackson has already provided a DNA sample and does not order another
The Court will determine sentence credit on a later date. 

Felony/Firearm warnings given
recess: 4:15pm
Review at 02-04-2016 02:30 pm
Criminal Case Settlement
from non-parties in support of the defendant and Wage Statements submitted by Attorney Rhiel

Cases 15CF237, 15CF271, 15CM147, 15CM219 & 15CM253 called together at 4:05 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM219:
Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Cases 15CM147 & 15CM253, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred

15CF237: 
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes weapon enhancer on Counts #2 & #3

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1, #2, #3 & #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts, further prosecution is barred and jeopardy attaches

Court informs parties that given the latesness of the day, It will arrange for a sentencing date to allow parties full opportunity to arguments
Recess: 4:28 pm 

NEXT:  15CF237, 15CF271 & 15CM219 (1) Schedule Sentencing 2/4/16 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
15CM147 & 15CM253 (1) Schedule Review 2/4/16 at 2:30 pm - Send notices

from the State advising that based on that all files are currently scheduled for Plea Hearing, the State does not intend to file any documents in compliance with the Court's Scheduling Order.

For Case 15CF237: 1)NOH for 12/16/15 Bail/Bond Hrg. 2)NOH for 4/18/16 FSSC 3)NOH for 4/20/16 Jury Trial 
For Case 15CM219: 1)NOH for 12/16/15 Bail/Bond Hrg. 2)NOH for 3/7/16 FSSC  3)NOH for 3/10/16 Jury Trial

Defendant is currently in custody at JCJ

Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases 15CF271, 15CM147, 15CM253, 15CF237, and 15CM219 called together at 10:30am [mo]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Records and case posture

Atty. Rhiel indicates that he has had discussion with the State, global resolution is a possibility
Atty. Rhiel requests a Bail Review Hearing be scheduled within the next week; he also requests that a Status Conference be scheduled in short time prior to the Court scheduling a Trial
--No objection from ADA Teuber

Atty. Rhiel rescinds his request to have a Status Conference scheduled for all cases, and requests Trials be scheduled in each of the cases. 
recess:10:45am--reconvene:10:55am [[to allow Parties to confer with the Court's JA for scheduling purposes]]

The Clerk announces the FSSC and Jury Trial dates
The Court distributes its scheduling order; notes the amendment it has made to the scheduling order 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of Bail Review Hearing; the Clerk announces the date. 
recess: 11:00am

Cases 15CF237, 15CF271, 15CM147, 15CM219 and 15CM253 called together at 10:13am [mo]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. De La Rosa orally Motion to Withdraw from Mr. Jackson's cases due to a conflict of interest.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that appointment of new counsel will be expedited
The Court directs the Court's JA to flag Mr. Jackson's cases and as soon as the Notice of successor counsel is received, the JA is to inquire of that new counsel of availability for STC as soon as possible.

Cases 15CM147, 15CM219, 15CM253 and 15CF237 called together at 3:12pm [mo]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF237(Arraignment occurs):

Mr. Jackson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts
--no demand for speedy trial at this time

As to all cases:
Atty. Hagemann requests that all cases be scheduled for a joint pretrial conference.
--no objection from DA Happ

recess: 3:19pm

Defendant Quinard M Jackson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases 15CF237 & 15CM253 called together at 1:45 pm [Clerk SH]
[Court Reporter: Ellen Walfoort]
Defendant Quinard M Jackson appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Atty De La Rosa is assigned to underlying matters and will be assigned in these cases as well

BOTH CASES: Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
15CF237: Atty Svehlek requests matter be set for prelim, but ok to set just outside timelines
15CM253: Pleas of Not Guilty entered; speedy trial waived by Defendant

Court requires a $500 CASH bond, to cover both files, with conditions:
-No contact with Shantavia Armstrong, DMD (1/10/06) or ASD (11/18/06) or Quinard Jackson
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No acts or threats of violence 

Recess: 2:00 pm

NEXT:  15CF237 (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 8/10/15 at 8:30 am & 15CM253 as STC on same date/time

Case called at 11:31 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for initial appearance)
Defendant Quinard M Jackson not in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Fryatt informs the Court that Mr. Jackson has two other pending matters, in which his counsel recently had a DA PTC on. Would normally request bench warrant, but it is possible that Mr. Jackson may have just gotton his dates confused. Requests matter be set over for initial appearance.
Court informs ADA Fryatt that It will have matter set for initial appearance during the same date/time as other pending matters are scheduled for status review
Recess: 11:32 AM 

NEXT:  Reschedule Initial Appearance before assigned Judge on 8/25/15 at 10:30 am with Mr. Jackson's other pending matters
